title: Paradise with Gin
history: The Paradise cocktail, a masterpiece combining the elegance of gin with the freshness of citrus, traces its roots back to the vibrant cocktail scene of the 1930s. Its creation is credited to the legendary bartender Harry Craddock, who first featured it in his influential book, 'The Savoy Cocktail Book', in 1930. This liquid paradise originated at the renowned Savoy Hotel in London, marking a milestone in cocktail history.
ingredients: 2 oz premium gin, such as Hendrick's or Tanqueray
3/4 oz triple sec orange liqueur, such as Cointreau
1/2 oz apricot liqueur, such as Giffard Abricot du Roussillon
instructions: In the shaker, add gin, triple sec, apricot liqueur, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 15-20 seconds.
Use the Hawthorne strainer to pour the mixture into a pre-chilled glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel twist, giving it a light squeeze over the surface to release aromatic oils.
recommendations: If you loved the Paradise, try the classic Gimlet, the sophisticated Aviation Cocktail, negroni or martini.
